title: Is it safe for my eyes to read on an e-reader like Kindle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes completely safe… you will need to adjust the brightness a bit if you are reading indoors where it is very dark, as obviously the brightness is really bright… it’s the same as if you have a very bright night lamp for example… I find the value of 8 - 10 quite comfortable… then, in a well lit room, pump it up a little more, then outside, you can switch it off…

For me reading on an eReader such as the Kindle is easier on my eyes that reading on any other device, including phone, tablet, and laptop, especially in ambient light. Whether these devices are safe for the eyes or not is the subject of continual research. If you search online, you’ll find a lot of articles that suggest that too much blue-light is damaging to the eye [1], [2]. As always, moderation is key.
